name: sanitytool
short_description:
This is the sanitytool developed by Texas Advanced Computing Center.
This tool is used to check the status of environment settings on supercomputer clusters.

Author:
Si Liu (siliu@tacc.utexas.edu)
Robert McLay (mclay@tacc.utexas.edu)

Version:
1.0.1

Current tests:
  1: SSH Permission Test:
  2: SSH Key Test:
  3: Report Standard Variables
  4: Whether blocked from submitting jobs on the system (Stampede Only)
  5: Check my allocation balance (Not on Yellowstone):
  6: Check quota under users' home and work
  7: Check Module environment
  8: Check compilers
  9: Check scheduler commands
